page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: GAZETEER, North East Leeds Harehills and Roundhay. The work shows a marked discrepancy in land cover between its Northern and Southern sections. The southern section is overwhelmingly composed of terraced houses, back to back or through-type, and mainly caters for working class people. This is reflected in the nature of the shops which serve the area, over 90 in a 4 sq km block. The northern section is 71% open land, recreational and farming. The largest park in the city is Roundhay Park, within the most northerly 4 sq kms. The housing is mainly large substantial character villas, detached and semi detached. The park is the venue for many sporting or social events.
